title: Tensor-based Regression Learning: Mathematical Foundations for Language Data Analysis and NLP Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Basic machine learning concepts, foundational linear algebra, and fundamental understanding of language data processing with experience in text preprocessing (normalization, tokenization)
context.additional_context: Emphasizes practical application of language data analysis skills through hands-on education. Parallels theoretical explanations and simple calculation practices due to technological constraints, including text data processing cases (tokenization, part-of-speech tagging). Focuses on improving learners' vocabulary analysis and text expression skills.

learning_goals: Explain the fundamental principles of tensor-based regression learning and compare differences with ELM (Extreme Learning Machine) from the perspectives of language data analysis and text structure.
Solve regression problems by applying the Moore-Penrose pseudoinverse calculation method for tensors to extract statistical patterns and vocabulary frequency from language data.

Learners can apply Type-2 fuzzy set concepts to tensor regression model implementation and build a text classification model achieving â‰¥85% sentiment analysis accuracy on a given NLP dataset (500 movie reviews).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
